syllabi_diff.math_scope: Chemistry (GCE O-Level syllabus 6092) — overall subject and assessment structure (papers 1–3, weightings, practical assessment).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: The subject remains Chemistry (O-Level 6092). Assessment structure, paper types, durations and weightings are the same in 2025 and 2026. Only minor editorial/publisher metadata changed (© line).

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Measurement and instrumentation: naming and using apparatus for time, temperature, mass, volume; experimental design variables; separation methods (filtration, crystallisation, distillation, chromatography) and interpretation of chromatograms (Rf).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Learning outcomes and practical techniques (including chromatography, Rf interpretation and apparatus expectations) are the same; no new quantitative methods introduced.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Qualitative particle theory and atomic structure: states of matter, kinetic particle explanations, relative charges and masses of subatomic particles, nuclide notation, isotopes; qualitative dependence of diffusion on mass and temperature.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Content identical — same subtopics and depth (no addition of orbital quantum classifications).

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Descriptive bonding models: ionic, covalent (dot-and-cross), metallic bonding; deducing structures and relating to macroscopic properties, comparison of allotropes (diamond vs graphite), alloys and macromolecules.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Topic scope and required representations (dot-and-cross, no lattice diagrams required) remain the same; no additions or removals of subtopics.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Numerical chemistry: Ar, Mr, definition of mole (Avogadro constant), percentage mass, empirical and molecular formulae, reacting masses, gas volumes (one mole = 24 dm^3 at RTP), concentration (mol/dm^3 or g/dm^3), titration calculations, limiting reactant problems, % yield and % purity.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Technical scope unchanged — same formulas, constants and calculation types. No new quantitative laws or variable-temperature gas law calculations introduced.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Ionic description of acids/alkalis (H+/OH-), pH conceptual scale and qualitative acidity/alkalinity comparisons (no pH calculations), strong vs weak acids qualitatively, neutralisation equations and solubility rules for salts.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Coverage and cognitive demand preserved; pH calculations remain excluded and only qualitative/ion-based descriptions required.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Identification tests and inference: precipitation reactions with NaOH/NH3, anion tests (carbonate, chloride, iodide, nitrate, sulfate), gas tests (CO2, O2, H2, NH3, Cl2, SO2). Emphasis on observational interpretation rather than quantitative analysis.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Same list of tests and expected outcomes; procedural expectations and exclusions (e.g., some SO2 tests not required) unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Conceptual and symbolic redox: definitions via oxygen/hydrogen gain–loss and electron transfer; identifying redox by changes in oxidation state; simple test reactions (KI, acidified KMnO4).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: No change in scope — redox defined both in classical and electron-transfer terms; same practical tests and cognitive level.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Predictive and symbolic work: electrolysis of molten and aqueous electrolytes, selective discharge principles (cations/anions, concentration effects, reactivity series), construction of ionic electrode equations, electroplating, purification of copper, simple cells and fuel cell concept (qualitative).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Topic content unchanged; quantitative Faraday-law calculations and detailed fuel cell construction are explicitly excluded in both versions.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Qualitative patterns and predictions: arranging by proton number, relation to electronic configuration, valence/ionic charge for first 20 elements, group trends (Groups 1, 17, 18), transition element characteristics and reactivity series with experimental deduction.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Same conceptual and inferential demands — predicting properties from periodic position and deducing reactivity from experimental data remain unchanged.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Energy conceptualisation: definition of enthalpy change (exothermic/endothermic), energy profile diagrams (∆H, activation energy), qualitative bond-breaking/bond-making energetics and overall enthalpy analysis.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Scope and cognitive demand preserved — qualitative energy diagrams and explanations required; no quantitative thermochemistry (entropy, Hess's law calculations) added.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Qualitative kinetics: effect of concentration, pressure, particle size, temperature and catalysts explained by collision theory; activation energy pathway reasoning; experimental design and data interpretation for reaction-rate investigations.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: No addition of rate equations or integrated rate-law mathematics; emphasis remains on conceptual collision-based explanations and practical data interpretation.

syllabi_diff.topic: Organic Chemistry (Fuels, Hydrocarbons, Alcohols, Acids, Esters, Polymers)
syllabi_diff.math_scope: Structural representation and nomenclature (C1–C4), homologous series formulas (alkanes CnH2n+2, alkenes CnH2n), isomer identification, simple organic reactions (combustion, addition, oxidation, esterification), polymer structures and deduced monomer–polymer relationships, recycling/disposal issues (qualitative).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Same coverage of structural drawing, naming and reaction types; no new mechanistic or advanced organic calculations introduced.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: Quantitative/qualitative atmospheric chemistry: composition of dry air (approx. % by volume), identification of pollutants and sources, pollutant mitigation reactions (e.g., catalytic converter redox, flue-gas desulfurisation), carbon cycle processes and greenhouse gas effects (qualitative impacts).
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Same learning outcomes and level of quantitative detail (percent by volume, qualitative cycle descriptions); no novel modelling or quantitative climate calculations added.

syllabi_diff.math_scope: List of required math skills: arithmetic operations, fractions/percentages/ratios, standard notation, direct/inverse proportion, positive integer indices, graph drawing/interpretation, unit conversion, dimensional reasoning (length/area/volume), solving x = yz algebraically, inequality/approximation symbols, use of significant figures.
syllabi_diff.change_summary: Mathematical competencies expected of candidates are unchanged; same explicit list of operations and graph skills.
